attributes.action: Program to eradicate Polio in the U.K.
attributes.background: Polio is a highly infectious condition resulting in various degrees of physical disabilities,

rejection.details:
You might this page about polio on the NHS website helpful: 

http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/polio/Pages/Introduction.aspx

You'll see from this that there hasn't been a case of polio caught in the UK since 1984. That's because routine vaccination was introduced in the mid-1950s.

The polio vaccination is already offered as part of the NHS routine childhood vaccination programme. We're not sure what additional action you'd like the UK Government or Parliament to take.
